moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5: I found the ruy lopez too tricky!! so
moves.3... Nd4: I found the ruy lopez too tricky!! therefor whenever i want to afford falling into a trap i simply force an exchange and simplify things!!
moves.4. Nxd4 exd4 5. O-O Nf6: even this variation of the ruy lopez can be very trick for black!! i have to move my knight out now otherwise pawn to e5 will make my life miserable!!
moves.6. d3 Be7 7. f4: i like my opponent his aggressive!! i am aggressive this gonna be a jam!!
moves.7... O-O 8. e5 Nd5 9. Bc4 Nb6 10. Bb3 a5: now in my earlier chess career i would have panicked but i quickly assessd the position and noticed that white wants to weaken my kingside and i see hes gonna succed no matter what i do because if i play f6 he plays e6 creating a very annoying blockade which shuts out my light sqaure bishop which makes an important defensive team along with the dark sqaure bishop and my queen but if i don't do anything white plays f6. opening up the g file.
moves.12... c5: well let him come i have confidence in my defenders plus whites pieces are not fully developed so i will counter attack in the center and cross my fingers!!
moves.13. f6 gxf6 14. Bh6 Re8 15. Qf3 Qd7: and his attack fizzles out!! white simply attacked too early with out proper development!!
moves.18. Bxf8 Kxf8 19. Qc7: i have no idea want white is thinking yes i see he is attacking my pieces but they are irrelevant. he now went from a great position to a bad position!!
moves.19... c4: i can't move my rook to e2 just yet but it definetly will happen! first i need to secure my back rank unfortunately this move was not the best move bishop d7 is better!!
moves.20. dxc4 dxc4 21. Qxb6 cxb3 22. Qxb3 Re2: now I am simply winning why? simply because i had a superior position I even made mistakes and I am still winning!! and all thanks to my opponent!!
blunder!!  but i think i can still force a draw!!
moves.38. Nxc4 Rxc4+ 39. Ke5 Ke8 40. Rd5 Re4+: finally! that pawn was one hell of a pain in the ass!!
moves.43. Re3+ Re6 44. Rd8+: wtf?? forget the draw now i think i can win!!
the final mistake in a game riddled with them!! what a game!!

opening: Ruy Lopez (C61), Bird's defence, Paulsen variation
